PARAM_ADMIN

Package to maintain settings for parameter groups

Author

Juergen Sieben, ConDeS GmbH

Published under MIT licence

Public Methods
set_import_mode
procedure set_import_mode(
p_mode in boolean
)

Method sets the package to import mode to allow for import of non modifiable parameters.

Parameter
p_mode
in boolean

Flag to indicate whether the package is in import mode (TRUE) or not (FALSE)

get_parameter_settings
function get_parameter_settings(
p_par_id in parameter_v.par_id%type,
p_pgr_id in parameter_group.pgr_id%type
)
return parameter_v%rowtype

Reads metadata for parameters. Is called to read settings regarding modifiability etc. Is used internally and from PARAM pkg

Parameters
p_par_id
in parameter_v.par_id%type

Name of the parameter

p_par_pgr_id

Name of the parameter group

Returns

Row of PARAMETER_V that contains all parameter related data with the exception of the actual parameter values

validate_parameter_group
procedure validate_parameter_group(
p_row in parameter_group%rowtype
)

Method to validate a parameter group entry prior to writing it to db

Parameter
p_row
in parameter_group%rowtype

PARAMETER_GROUP record to validate

edit_parameter_group
procedure edit_parameter_group(
p_pgr_id in parameter_group.pgr_id%type,
p_pgr_description in parameter_group.pgr_description%type,
p_pgr_is_modifiable in boolean default true
)

Method to change the definition of a parameter group.

Is called by the developer to maintain the settings of a parameter group.  May be used to create a new parameter group as well.

Parameters
p_pgr_id
in parameter_group.pgr_id%type

Name of the parameter group

p_pgr_description
in parameter_group.pgr_description%type

Longtext description of the parameter group

p_pgr_is_modifiable
in boolean

Flag indicating whether parameters within this group are allowed to be modifiable by the end user

edit_parameter_group
procedure edit_parameter_group(
p_row in parameter_group%rowtype
)

Method to change the definition of a parameter group.

Is called by the developer to maintain the settings of a parameter group.  May be used to create a new parameter group as well.

Parameter
p_row
in parameter_group%rowtype

PARAMETER_GROUP record to validate

delete_parameter_group
procedure delete_parameter_group(
p_pgr_id in parameter_group.pgr_id%type,
p_force in boolean default false
)

Method to delete a parameter group.

Parameters
p_pgr_id
in parameter_group.pgr_id%type

Name of the parameter group

p_force]

Optional flag to indicate whether all referencing parameters should be deleted (TRUE) or not (FALSE, default)

harmonize_parameter_group
procedure harmonize_parameter_group(
p_pgr_id in parameter_group.pgr_id%type
)

Method to harmonize local and default parameters after import.

Is called after importing a parameter group. It searches for local parameters which do not exist in the default parameter list anymore and deletes them

Parameter
p_pgr_id
in parameter_group.pgr_id%type

Name of the parameter group

edit_parameter_realm
procedure edit_parameter_realm(
p_pre_id in parameter_realm.pre_id%type,
p_pre_description in parameter_realm.pre_description%type,
p_pre_is_active in boolean default true
)

Method to change the definition of a parameter realm.

Is called by the developer to maintain the settings of a parameter realm.  May be used to create a new parameter realm as well.

Parameters
p_pre_id
in parameter_realm.pre_id%type

Name of the parameter realm

p_pre_description
in parameter_realm.pre_description%type

Longtext description of the parameter realm

p_pgr_is_active

Flag to indicate whether realm is in use actually

edit_parameter_realm

)

Method to change the definition of a parameter realm.

Is called by the developer to maintain the settings of a parameter realm.  May be used to create a new parameter realm as well.

delete_parameter_realm
procedure delete_parameter_realm(
p_pre_id in parameter_realm.pre_id%type,
p_force in boolean default false
)

Method to delete a parameter realm

Parameters
p_pre_id
in parameter_realm.pre_id%type

ID of the parameter realm to delete

p_force
in boolean

Optional flag to indicate whether local parameters of this realm are to be deleted (TRUE) or whether an error is thrown if the realm is in use (FALSE)

edit_parameter_type
procedure edit_parameter_type(
p_pat_id in parameter_type.pat_id%type,
p_pat_description in parameter_type.pat_description%type
)

Method to edit the definition of a parameter type.

Procedure is called by the developer to edit parameter types.  Paramater types are used to define the kind of string type a parameter has.  Examples are HTML, SQL or similar. They are used to control which editer is used to edit the parameter value on the UI

Parameters
p_pat_id
in parameter_type.pat_id%type

Name of the parameter type

p_pat_description
in parameter_type.pat_description%type

Longtext description of the parameter type

validate_parameter
procedure validate_parameter(
p_row in parameter_v%rowtype
)

Method to validate a parameter if a validation string exists

Parameter
p_parameter

Parameter to check

edit_parameter
procedure edit_parameter(
p_par_id in parameter_tab.par_id%type,
p_par_pgr_id in parameter_tab.par_pgr_id%type,
p_par_description in parameter_tab.par_description%type default null,
p_par_string_value in parameter_tab.par_string_value%type default null,
p_par_xml_value in parameter_tab.par_xml_value%type default null,
p_par_integer_value in parameter_tab.par_integer_value%type default null,
p_par_float_value in parameter_tab.par_float_value%type default null,
p_par_date_value in parameter_tab.par_date_value%type default null,
p_par_timestamp_value in parameter_tab.par_timestamp_value%type default null,
p_par_boolean_value in boolean default null,
p_par_is_modifiable in boolean default null,
p_par_pat_id in parameter_tab.par_pat_id%type default null,
p_par_validation_string in parameter_tab.par_validation_string%type default null,
p_par_validation_message in parameter_tab.par_validation_message%type default null
)

Method to edit a parameter

Parameters
p_par_id
in parameter_tab.par_id%type

Name of the parameter

p_par_pgr_id
in parameter_tab.par_pgr_id%type

Name of the parameter group

p_par_description
in parameter_tab.par_description%type

Optional description of the parameter

p_par_string_value
in parameter_tab.par_string_value%type

CLOB parameter value

p_par_xml_value
in parameter_tab.par_xml_value%type

XML parameter value

p_par_integer_value
in parameter_tab.par_integer_value%type

Integer parameter value

p_par_float_value
in parameter_tab.par_float_value%type

Float parameter value

p_par_date_value
in parameter_tab.par_date_value%type

Date parameter value

p_par_timestamp_value
in parameter_tab.par_timestamp_value%type

Timestamp with time zone parameter value

p_par_boolean_value
in boolean

Boolean parameter value

p_pgr_is_modifiable

Flag indicating whether this parameter is modifiable by the end user

p_par_pat_id
in parameter_tab.par_pat_id%type

String type of the parameter, Reference to PARAMETER_TYPE.

p_par_validation_string
in parameter_tab.par_validation_string%type

PL/SQL-chunk to validate a parameter value entered. Is used to validate parameter values

p_par_validation_message
in parameter_tab.par_validation_message%type

Name of a Message that is thrown if a validation of the parameter fails.

edit_realm_parameter
procedure edit_realm_parameter(
p_par_id parameter_v.par_id%type,
p_par_pgr_id parameter_v.par_pgr_id%type,
p_par_pre_id in parameter_realm.pre_id%type,
p_par_string_value in parameter_v.par_string_value%type default null,
p_par_xml_value in parameter_v.par_xml_value%type default null,
p_par_integer_value in parameter_v.par_integer_value%type default null,
p_par_float_value in parameter_v.par_float_value%type default null,
p_par_date_value in parameter_v.par_date_value%type default null,
p_par_timestamp_value in parameter_v.par_timestamp_value%type default null,
p_par_boolean_value in boolean default null
)

Sets a realm parameter value.

Is called to persist realm related parameters These parameters contrast local parameters in that they have different values per "realm", i.e. for a dev, test or production environment.  As such, those parameters are persisted centrally.

Parameters
p_par_id
parameter_v.par_id%type

Name of the parameter

p_par_pgr_id
parameter_v.par_pgr_id%type

Name of the parameter group

p_par_pre_id
in parameter_realm.pre_id%type

Name of the parameter realm

in parameter_v.par_string_value%type

CLOB parameter value

p_par_xml_value
in parameter_v.par_xml_value%type

XML parameter value

p_par_integer_value
in parameter_v.par_integer_value%type

Integer parameter value

p_par_float_value
in parameter_v.par_float_value%type

Float parameter value

p_par_date_value

Date parameter value

p_par_timestamp_value
in parameter_v.par_timestamp_value%type

export_parameter_group
function export_parameter_group(
p_pgr_id in parameter_group.pgr_id%type
)
return clob

Method to create a script for all parameters within a parameter group as a clob instance.

Is called to create an installation file as CLOB to be downloaded at the clients browser

Parameter
p_pgr_id
in parameter_group.pgr_id%type

Parameter group to create a clob installation file for
